results.title: Tropfest #9 2001: 16 finalists
results.brief_description: The Sydney Film Festival, Tropfest, is the world’s largest short film festival, held one night in February each year at the Domain, Royal Botanic Gardens, Sydney. The aim is to showcase work from young and emerging filmmakers, providing them with a festival atmosphere to screen their works to peers. In an attempt to encourage production, not just the exhibition of films, the festival has a Tropfest Signature Item, announced a few months prior to the festival. Each film must contain the TSI in whatever form the filmmaker sees fit. In 2001, the TSI is ‘horn’ and the interpretations leap from, ‘The French’, to something a lot more personal. This tape contains 16 finalists which includes: “A Matter of life” (dir. Jennifer Perrott); “Tickler” (dir. Clayton Jacobson); “Muffled love” (dir. Rene Hernandez); “The Lighter” (dir. Patrick Hughes); “Just not cricket” (dir. Matt Wheeldon); “The Art of farewell” (dir. David Napier); “Beep” (dir. Eddie Edwards); “Like it is” (dirs. Chris Begley, Tony D’Aquino); “Home straight” (dir. Mickey Power); “Chopper” (dir. Bernard Derriman); “A Day at the zoo” (dir. Matthew Gidney); “Playin’ hard to get” (dir. Tim Bullock); “Boambee return” (dir. Liz Crosby); “Burn” (dir. Michael Dunning); “The Cutting room floor” (dir. Steve Baker); “Ride on” (dir. Nick Wyles).

results.title: Trooping the colour: a famous British ceremony
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An authentic description of one of Britain’s most colourful ceremonies. Includes footage of Queen Elizabeth II, Duke of Edinburgh and Duke of Gloucester.

results.title: Trooping the colour, 1964
results.brief_description: Newsreel magazine recording the Trooping the Colour ceremony in 1964. Contains footage of Queen Elizabeth II leaving Buckingham Palace on horse to attend the ceremony and appearing on the balcony with 3 month-old Prince Edward and other members of the Royal family at the end of the ceremony. Provides a detailed description and explanation of this famous ceremony.

results.title: Trooping the colour, 1949
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents the ceremony of Trooping the Colour by the Brigade of Horse Guards on the occasion of the King’s birthday, 9th June, 1949. His Majesty, King George VI, and the Duke of Gloucester take part in the ceremony and the then Princess Elizabeth takes the salute at this impressive ceremony.

results.title: Trooping the colour, [1947]
results.brief_description: Presents the ceremony of Trooping the Colour on the occasion of King George VI’s birthday on 9th June, 1947(?) with the then Princess Elizabeth taking the salute. Also includes segments on the Royal Braemar Gathering, attended by King George VI, Princess Elizabeth and Princess Margaret, and Changing of the Guard. This is a silent film with captions.

results.title: TRON: Legacy
results.creator_credit: Revolution Sun Studios, Walt Disney Pictures, LivePlanet, Prana Studios, Sean Bailey Productions, Kontsept Film Company, Steven Lisberger, Jeffrey Silver, Michael Wilkinson, Richard Jefferies, Joseph Kosinski, Sean Bailey, Edward Kitsis, Adam Horowitz and Darren Gilford
results.brief_description: Sam Flynn, the tech-savvy and daring son of Kevin Flynn, investigates his father’s disappearance and is pulled into The Grid. With the help of a mysterious program named Quorra, Sam quests to stop evil dictator Clu from crossing into the real world.

constellations_other.name: VR dreams
constellations_other.description: Since VR's inception creators have explored the ways VR could be used to enhance our lives and even extend them.

results.title: Tron [short version]
results.creator_credit: Steven Lisberger, Donald Kushner and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: This is an adapted version of the feature-length film of the same name. It is a story about a whizkid computer programmer trapped inside a computer world where he is pitted against electronic foes. Featuring some very impressive computer-generated animation. Cast includes Jeff Bridges, David Warner and Bruce Boxleitner. Nominated for Best Costume and Best Sound in the 1982 Academy Awards.

results.title: Trombone and tuba
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and music lover. Professional musicians show how the trombone and the tuba are played, demonstrate their range and tone and how to care for them.

results.title: Troll in Central Park
results.creator_credit: Gary Goldman, Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Don Bluth Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Stanley is not your usual troll because he has a kind heart and a wonderful magical gift. His “green thumb” can create flowers at a touch. Wicked Queen Gnorga of the Trolls sends Stanley to New York where there is little green growing. He takes refuge in Central Park where he befriends Gus and Rosie. Unfortunately for the trio Queen Gnorga decides to spoil their fun and lets her mischief magic wreak havoc in the Big Apple. With the voices of Dom DeLuise, Cloris Leachman and Hayley Mills.
